Subject: RE: [junit] Re: Help Please


I had this error when I first used JUnit. It's caused by using the
default no argument constructor (which as you can see is not made public
in JUnit). You MUST define a one argument constructor. Here's the one I
use.

    // One Argument Constructor
    public <myobject>Test(String name) {
        super(name);
    }

This should help! :-)

Simon
